de.gnwi.spicesviewer

Class MenuBar

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JMenuBar
            • de.gnwi.spicesviewer.MenuBar
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.MenuElement

    public class MenuBar
extends javax.swing.JMenuBar
    A JMenuBar for the application's MainFrame. It contains menus for setting graph properties (like node shape, node color, behavior for long particle names and opening the AdditionalSettingsDialog), application properties (error color and 'valid' color) and for screenshotting the graph or frame.
    Author:
    Jonas Schaub
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      javax.swing.JMenuItem getAdditionalSettingsMenuItem()
      Returns the menu bar's menu item that is supposed to open the AdditionalSettingsDialog.
      javax.swing.JMenuItem getErrorColorChangerMenuItem()
      Returns the menu bar's menu item that is supposed to let the user choose a new error color via a JColorChooser for the application's error messages.
      javax.swing.JCheckBoxMenuItem getFullParticleNameDisplayMenuBox()
      Returns the menu bar's checkbox menu item in the graph settings menu that is supposed to determine whether the particle names should be written out in full on the Spices graph's nodes.
      javax.swing.JMenuItem getImageExportByFileSinkImagesMenuItem()
      Returns the menu bar's menu item that is supposed to export the Spices graph as an image file by using GraphStream's FileSinkImages class.
      javax.swing.JMenuItem getImageExportByGraphAttributeMenuItem()
      Returns the menu bar's menu item that is supposed to export the Spices graph as an image file by using a 'ui.screenshot' graph attribute.
      javax.swing.JMenuItem getImageExportBySwingMenuItem()
      Returns the menu bar's menu item that is supposed to export the Spices graph as an image file using Swing.
      javax.swing.JMenuItem getImageExportFileDirMenuItem()
      Returns the menu bar's menu item that is supposed to allow the user to set the directory where the exported image files should be saved.
      javax.swing.JMenu getImageExportMenu()
      Returns the menu bar's image export menu.
      javax.swing.JMenuItem getNodeColorChangerMenuItem()
      Returns the menu bar's menu item that is supposed to let the user choose a new node color for the Spices graph via a JColorChooser.
      javax.swing.JRadioButtonMenuItem[] getNodeShapeRadioButtons()
      Returns every radio button in the menu bar's node shape submenu.
      javax.swing.JMenuItem getRestoreAppSettingsMenuItem()
      REturns the menu bar's menu item that is supposed to restore the application's settings (error color and valid color) to their default values.
      javax.swing.JMenuItem getRestoreGraphSettingsMenuItem()
      Returns the menu bar's menu item that is supposed to restore the Spices graph's settings to their default values.
      javax.swing.JMenuItem getRestoreNodeColorMenuItem()
      Returns the menu bar's menu item that is supposed to restore the Spices graph's node color to its default value.
      javax.swing.JMenuItem getRestoreNodeShapeMenuItem()
      Returns the menu bar's menu item that is supposed to restore the Spices graph's node shape to its default value.
      javax.swing.JMenuItem getScreenshotOfWholeFrameMenuItem()
      Returns the menu bar's menu item that is supposed to screenshot the whole main frame using Swing.
      javax.swing.JMenuItem getValidColorChangerMenuItem()
      Returns the menu bar's menu item that is supposed to let the user choose a new valid color via a JColorChooser for the application's valid message.
